data.prayer: Jesus, help the local leaders in Barmer, Rajasthan, India not be proud but humble, and willing to wash the feet of all they serve.
data.verse: “You call me ‘Teacher’ and ‘Lord,’ and rightly so, for that is what I am. Now that I, your Lord and Teacher, have washed your feet, you also should wash one another’s feet. I have set you an example that you should do as I have done for you.

data.location_label: Photo from the county of Barmer, Rajasthan, India

data.prayer: Father, convict the 28,642 believers in Barmer to be holy and righteous. Inspire them to gather in small groups for accountability and spiritual growth.
Spirit, inspire new kinds of evangelism through social media in Barmer, Rajasthan, India.
data.verse: But you, keep your head in all situations, endure hardship, do the work of an evangelist, discharge all the duties of your ministry.

data.prayer: Lord, the believers in the county of Barmer, Rajasthan, India need teachers who can feed them with knowledge and understanding. Please raise them up.
data.verse: Then I will give you shepherds after My own heart, who will feed you with knowledge and understanding.

data.prayer: Lord, Let your Kingdom come among the Rajput Jadeja people. Let your will be done, as in heaven, so on earth.
Spirit, teach the church in the county of Barmer to increase their prayer for your kingdom to come.
data.verse: Now when Daniel learned that the decree had been published, he went home to his upstairs room where the windows opened toward Jerusalem. Three times a day he got down on his knees and prayed, giving thanks to his God...

data.prayer: Father, let the threatened of Barmer, Rajasthan, India know that it is better to trust in you than to trust in humans.
data.verse: It is better to take refuge in the Lord than to trust in humans.

data.prayer: Good Shepherd, thank you that you know the name of each of the 28,642 believers in Barmer.
data.verse: I am the good shepherd; I know my sheep and my sheep know me

location.name: Barmer
location.people_groups_list: Rabari (Hindu traditions), Dafer, Bhil Rathia, Mutwa, Raysipotra
location.people_groups_list_w_pop: Rabari (Hindu traditions) (6,100), Dafer (300), Bhil Rathia (83,000), Mutwa (1,200), Raysipotra (600)
